definition: to damage the public interest for personal profit (idiom); personal profit at public expense/venal and selfish behavior
to decrease/to lose/to damage/to harm/(coll.) to speak sarcastically/to deride/caustic/mean/one of the 64 hexagrams of the Book of Changes (䷨)

public/collectively owned/common/international (e.g. high seas, metric system, calendar)/make public/fair/just/Duke, highest of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/honorable (gentlemen)/father-in-law/male (animal)
fat/fertile/loose-fitting or large/to fertilize/to become rich by illegal means/fertilizer/manure
personal/private/selfish

sentences.english: This dishonest officer lines his nest every month.
sentences.chinese: 这个不诚实的官员每月都损公肥私。

definition: to use one's position for personal gain (idiom)
to stuff one's pockets/to take bribes
to gain from corrupt dealing/to engage in graft/to feather one's nest
to break the law and violate discipline (idiom)
official authority used for private interests (idiom); to attain private ends by abusing public position
see 徇私舞弊[xun4 si1 wu3 bi4]
to make a profit/to gain/to get an advantage
taking or eating more than one's due (idiom); greedy and selfish
to gang up for personal interest (idiom)/to form a clique
harming others for one's personal benefit (idiom); personal gain to the detriment of others
buying and selling of official positions
corruption and abuse of the law (idiom); to take bribes and bend the law
to deceive one's superiors and bully one's subordinates (idiom)
corruption
to be corrupt/corruption/to embezzle
personal gain/(one's own) selfish interest
